metadata.title: CVE-2019-9233 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
In wpa_supplicant_8, there is a possible out of bounds read due to anincorrect bounds check. This could lead to remote information disclosurewith no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is notneeded for exploitation. Product: AndroidVersions: Android-10Android ID:A-122529021

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9233` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

eapoltest - 2:2.9.0-21
hostapd - 2:2.9.0-21
wpagui - 2:2.9.0-21
wpasupplicant - 2:2.9.0-21
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wpa package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:2.9.0-21').
